meanings.definition: A short sermon or discourse, often on a religious or moral topic.
meanings.sent1: During the church service, the pastor gave a moving sermonette about kindness.
meanings.sent2: The minister prepared a sermonette for the Sunday morning service.
meanings.sent3: The children's sermonette about sharing made the kids giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her sermonette on forgiveness was like a gentle breeze on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The memorable sermonette on gratitude touched many hearts.

meanings.definition: To deliver a brief sermon or moralizing talk.
meanings.sent1: The guest speaker will sermonette at the event tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She sermonetted about the importance of honesty to the audience.
meanings.sent3: He sermonetted to his friends about the benefits of recycling.
meanings.sent4: The teacher sermonetted to the students about the value of hard work.
meanings.sent5: The coach sermonetted the team on teamwork before the big game.
